newsitem.title: JORDAN: King Hussein frees Jordan bread riot detainees.
newsitem.headline: King Hussein frees Jordan bread riot detainees.

text.p: Jordan's King Hussein has declared a general amnesty for all detainees arrested in connection with widespread bread riots in August, the state news agency Petra reported on Tuesday.
It said the king's amnesty also extended to any prisoners not considered a threat to public security or whose term behind bars was considered sufficient punishment.

"We request you to take measures to halt prosecution of those who deviated from the right way and harmed their country...in the events connected with the change in the wheat subsidies," Petra quoted the king as instructing Prime Minister Abdul-Karim al-Kabariti in a letter.
The king's letter gave no indication of how many people would be covered by the amnesty.
Government officials said hundreds of people were arrested after the rioting, the worst civil unrest in Jordan for seven years. But they said most had subsequently been released.
The king also instructed Kabariti to "look again at the sale price of bread" in light of the fall in world grain prices from their record levels earlier this year.
